page.title: 07ST BARNABAS CHURCH, FACCOMBE
page.content: First built about 1860 and renovated several times before 1910. The church, which has a square tower, is built of flint. The Churchyard is well kept and used as the burial ground. The Lych gate was erected in 1953 as a memorial to a previous owner of the Manor, as was the wood panelling in the Chancel. The pipe organ was installed in 1928. The electric blower must have been added later. The font is very old. There are two memorial plaques which came from the old church at Netherton. The church is one of four churches of the United Benefice of Hurstbourne Tarrant, where the Vicar lives. Services are held twice a month, Holy communion being celebrated at one of these. There are two Churchwardens and a Parochial Church Council.
